metadata.title: CVE-2020-35733 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Erlang/OTP before 23.2.2. The ssl application10.2 accepts and trusts an invalid X.509 certificate chain to a trustedroot Certification Authority.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-35733` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

erlang - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3
erlang-asn1 - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3
erlang-base - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3
erlang-base-hipe - 1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3

criterions.comment: erlang package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:18.3-dfsg-1ubuntu3').
